alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 12 at 5:44PM EDT until April 12 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHERN MIAMI-DADE COUNTY... At 544 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms producing heavy rain has moved out of the area. However, rainfall amounts of 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen from these thunderstorms. This amount of rainfall will take some time to drain away. Therefore, the flash flood warning remain in effect until 745 PM EDT this evening. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Coral Gables, South Miami, Kendall, Doral, Pinecrest, Miami Springs, Sweetwater, West Miami, Coral Terrace, University Of Miami, Miami International Airport, Westchester, Glenvar Heights, Coconut Grove, Olympia Heights, Fountainbleau, Sunset and University Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
